physical_appearance:The enlarger timer is black in colour and it has two large adjust buttons
 a start button
 and a switch to change the modes of the device. At the front of the enlarging timer
 the brand \u0027LPL\u0027 and the name of its model
 \u0027Enlarging Timer ET-200\u0027
 are displayed. It is accompanied with a two-pin black wire. The packaging of the enlarger timer is made of cardboard and it is brown in colour. At the front of the cardboard packaging
 the brand \u0027LPL\u0027 and the name of its product
 \u00275553 Enlarging Timer ET-200 LPL Co. Ltd Tokyo-Japan\u0027
 are displayed. The features of the enlarging timer are stated in three lines of point form

sgcool_label_text:An enlarger timer is used to control how long the exposure will be in photographic film processing. An electronic timer such as this is connected to the enlarger
 turning the enlarger lamp on and off automatically. This enlarger timer is part of the darkroom photography equipment that was previously used by The Picture Farm
 which was set up by the renowned photographer Willie Tang.

metadata.physical_appearance: The enlarger timer is black in colour and it has two large adjust buttons, a start button, and a switch to change the modes of the device. At the front of the enlarging timer, the brand 'LPL' and the name of its model, 'Enlarging Timer ET-200', are displayed. It is accompanied with a two-pin black wire. The packaging of the enlarger timer is made of cardboard and it is brown in colour. At the front of the cardboard packaging, the brand 'LPL' and the name of its product, '5553 Enlarging Timer ET-200 LPL Co. Ltd Tokyo-Japan', are displayed. The features of the enlarging timer are stated in three lines of point form

metadata.sgcool_label_text: An enlarger timer is used to control how long the exposure will be in photographic film processing. An electronic timer such as this is connected to the enlarger, turning the enlarger lamp on and off automatically. This enlarger timer is part of the darkroom photography equipment that was previously used by The Picture Farm, which was set up by the renowned photographer Willie Tang.
